Class java.Nutmeg.Bag

  Class java.Nutmeg.Bag



java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.Nutmeg.Collection
           |
           +----java.Nutmeg.Bag






  
 public class Bag
  
 extends Collection


Copyright (c) 1995, 1996 THOUGHT Inc. All Rights Reserved.

Bag class (a growable array).

This is a fully functional subclass of Collection which is different in
that it doesn't allow for address specific (ie. the at() method) access
to the Objects.





  




  
 
	Bag(int, int)
  
 Constructor for Bag with an initial storage capacity and a 
specified growSize.
  
 
	Bag(int)
  
 Constructs an empty collection with the specified storage capacity, and
a default capacity increment.
  
 
	Bag()
  
 Construct an empty collection.




  




  
 
	add(Object)
  
 Inserts the specified object, if the object already exists, then the
new object is added after the first occurrence.
  
 
	add(Object, int)
  
 Inserts the specified object, numInserts number of times, if the 
object already exists, then the new object is added after the first 
occurrence.
  
 
	at(int)
  
 WARNING!
This is not a valid method for this class, and will result in an
exception being thrown.
  
 
	atPut(int, Object)
  
 WARNING!
This is not a valid method for this class, and will result in an
exception being thrown.
  
 
	clone()
  
 Clone this Bag.
  
 
	initialize(int)
  
 (Re)Initialize the dataspace, and set the object count to 0.





  




Bag

  public Bag(int initialSize,
             int growSize)




  
 Constructor for Bag with an initial storage capacity and a 
specified growSize.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage
    
 growSize - the increment that storage should grow by
size doubles if value is 0.
  




Bag

  public Bag(int initialSize)




  
 Constructs an empty collection with the specified storage capacity, and
a default capacity increment.  Capacity increment is defaulted to 0
using this constructor.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage.
  




Bag

  public Bag()




  
 Construct an empty collection.  This defaults to an initial storage
capacity of 10 objects, and a growSize of 0.





  



add

  public synchronized Object add(Object anObject)




  
 Inserts the specified object, if the object already exists, then the
new object is added after the first occurrence.  If the object is new
to the list, it will be added to the end.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to insert
    
 Overrides:
    
 add in class Collection
  




add

  public synchronized void add(Object anObject,
                               int numInserts)




  
 Inserts the specified object, numInserts number of times, if the 
object already exists, then the new object is added after the first 
occurrence.  If the object is new to the list, it will be added to 
the end.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to insert
    
 numInserts - number of copies of anObject to be inserted
  




at

  public synchronized Object at(int anInt)




  
 WARNING!
This is not a valid method for this class, and will result in an
exception being thrown.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - the integer position of the object.
    
 Throws: NotImplementedInThisClass
    
 not a valid call for this class

                                   Object anObject)




  
 WARNING!

 Parameters:
    
 anInt - the integer position of the object.
    
 Throws: NotImplementedInThisClass
    
 not a valid call for this class
  




initialize

  public final synchronized void initialize(int initialSize)




  
 (Re)Initialize the dataspace, and set the object count to 0.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - Sets the buffer size of the dataspace.
  




clone

  public synchronized Object clone()




  
 Clone this Bag. The objects are not cloned, and are references,
If new members are desired, use the deepcopy method.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 a new Object identical to the current one.
    
 Overrides:
    
 clone in class Collection
